The XML Hypermedia W3C Community group proposal was accepted, and you can j=
oin or follow (preferably join!) here:

--- In rest-discuss@yahoogroups.com, "Rushforth, Pet=
er" <peter.rushforth@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
> 
> In recent discussions about x=
ml:href, xml:src, xml:rel, xml:type,  xml:hreflang , xml:method and xml:tre=
f on xml-dev, I've been persuaded that the best/fasted way to turn XML into=
 a hypermedia language is to initiate a W3C Community Group dedicated to th=
is subject, where community opinion can be gathered and represented.
> 
> h=
ttp://www.w3.org/community/groups/proposed/#xmlhypermedia
> 
> So far, the =
idea has received some support, but I feel that there is a lot of latent su=
pport out there, and some focused application of hypermedia expertise is al=
l that is required to help XML to become a native hypermedia language.
> 
>=
 The bugzilla bug on this topic is here:
> 
> https://www.w3.org/Bugs/Publi=
c/show_bug.cgi?id=3D17659
> 
> I hope that you will consider joining the W3=
C XML Hypermedia Community Group, in that any changes to W3C standards must=
 be driven by user requirements, and the Community Groups are designed to g=
ather those.   So, if I've misrepresented the requirements, please join and=
 help clarify them.  If you agree with the requirements, please join to sho=
w your support.  The more members, the better the chance of change.
> 
> Th=
ank you!
> 
> Peter
>
